sentences.sentence: The Fox( 狐狸 ) Without a Tail
It happened that a fox( 狐狸 ) was caught in a trap( 陷阱 ), and lost his tail.
At first, he didn’t want to show himself among other foxes( 狐狸 ).
At last, he decided to face them, and called all the foxes( 狐狸 ) to a meeting.
When they had got together, the fox( 狐狸 ) said that they should all get rid of( 除去 ) their tails.
He said that a tail was inconvenient( 不便的 ) when they were being chased( 被追赶 ) by dogs,
and when they wanted to sit down and chat( 聊天 ) with each other.
All foxes( 狐狸 ) would look much better and have easier lives without their tails.
“That is all very well,” said one of the older foxes( 狐狸 ).
“But we think the only reason you told us to get rid of( 除去 ) our tails is that you have lost yours.”
MORAL: Don’t trust selfish( 自私的 ) advice.
The Frog( 青蛙 ) and the Ox( 公牛 )
“Oh, father,” said a little frog( 青蛙 ) to the big one sitting by the side of a pool,
“I have seen such a terrible monster( 怪物 )! It was as big as a mountain, with horns( 角 ) on its head, and a long tail.”
“Quiet, child,” said the old frog( 青蛙 ),
“that was only an ox( 公牛 ). It isn’t so big.
He may be a little bit taller than me, but I can easily make myself just as wide.”
So he blew, and blew, and blew himself out. “Was he as big as me?” he asked.
“Oh, much bigger than you,” said the young frog( 青蛙 ).
Again the old one blew himself out, and asked the young one if the ox( 公牛 ) was as big as himself.
“Bigger, father, bigger,” was the reply.
So the frog( 青蛙 ) took a deep breath( 深呼吸 ), and blew and blew and blew, and got bigger and bigger and bigger.
Then he said, “I'm sure the ox( 公牛 ) is not as big as me.”
But at this moment, he burst( 爆炸 ).
MORAL: Vanity( 自负 ) may lead to disaster( 祸患 ).
The Frog( 青蛙 ) Doctor
A frog( 青蛙 ) once told all the animals that he was a doctor, and could treat all illnesses.
A fox( 狐狸 ) asked him, “How can you say this when you can’t even treat your own skin?”
MORAL: Those who say they can help others should first help themselves.
The Frogs( 青蛙 ) and the Well( 井 )
Two frogs( 青蛙 ) lived in the same pool.
When the pool dried up under the summer’s heat, they left it and set out together to find another home.
As they went along, they passed a deep well( 井 ) with a lot of water in it.
When they saw it, one of the frogs( 青蛙 ) said to the other,
“Let us jump down into this well( 井 ) and live in it. It can provide us with both shelter( 住所 ) and food.”
But the other replied, more cautiously( 谨慎地 ),
“But what if the rains do not come and the water in the well( 井 ) dries up( 干涸 )? How can we get out again from so great a depth( 深度 )?”
MORAL: Think ahead.
The Frogs( 青蛙 ) Who Wanted a King
Some frogs( 青蛙 ) were living happily in a lake with no one bothering( 打扰 ) them, until they decided they wanted a King.
They chose an old log( 木材 ) lying in the lake, and at first they were very happy with their King Log( 木材 ).
They would climb on top of him to enjoy the sun, and play games to see who could jump the farthest from the top of King Log( 木头 ).
But then they started to get bored with their King.
They said to each other,
“First of all, King Log( 木头 ) is very ugly—he’s all dirty and slimy( 黏糊糊的 ).
Secondly, King Log( 木头 ) doesn’t do anything—he just lies there.
We want a handsome King – a powerful King, an active King!”
So for their new king, they chose King Stork( 鹳 ) – a very handsome, powerful, and active bird who could not believe his luck.
Of course, King Stork( 鹳 ) soon killed and ate all the frogs( 青蛙 ).
MORAL: Don’t be too quick to change your rulers.

question.cn: 在故事The Fox Without a Tail中，狐狸是怎样失去尾巴的？
question.en: In the story the Fox Without a Tail, how did the fox lose his tail?

options.en: He was caught in a trap.
His tail was bitten off by a dog.
He cut off his own tail.

analysis: 文中提到：“It happened that a fox was caught in a trap, and lost his tail.”可知狐狸是掉进陷阱里，失去了自己的尾巴，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Frog and the Ox中，老青蛙最后怎么了？
question.en: In the story The Frog and the Ox, what happened to the old frog at last?

options.en: He had a fight with the ox.
He blew himself out and burst.

analysis: 文中提到：“Again the old one blew himself out, and asked the young one if the ox was as big as himself. . . But at this moment, he burst.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Frog Doctor中，为什么其他动物不认为青蛙是个好大夫？
question.en: In the story the Frog Doctor, why didn't the other animals think the frog was a good doctor?

options.cn: 因为青蛙大夫没有穿着职业服。
options.en: Because the frog doctor didn't wear professional clothing.

options.cn: 因为青蛙大夫不能医治自己的皮肤。
options.en: Because the frog doctor couldn't treat his own skin.

options.cn: 因为青蛙大夫没有医疗器械。
options.en: Because the frog doctor didn't have medical instruments.

analysis: 文中提到青蛙说：“He could treat all illness.”但狐狸又问他：“How can you say this when you can't even treat your own skin?”可知，青蛙大夫不能医治自己的皮肤，所以其他动物并不相信他，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事Two Frogs lived in the same pool中，两只青蛙为什么要离开以前的家？
question.en: In the story Two Frogs, why did the two frogs leave their previous home?

options.en: Their previous home was too small.

options.cn: 他们之前的家被暴雨冲毁了。
options.en: Their previous home was destroyed by heavy rain.

options.cn: 他们之前的家在夏天干涸了。
options.en: Their previous home dried up in the summer.

analysis: 文中提到：“When the pool dried up under the summer's heat, they left it.”可知他们原来的家在烈日下干涸，所以青蛙才搬家，因此选C。

question.cn: 在The Frogs Who Wanted a King中，青蛙后来为什么要更换国王？
question.en: In the story the Frogs Who Wanted a King, why did the frogs change their king?

options.en: King Log was eaten by a stork.

options.cn: 他们想要一个既帅气，又强壮，还活跃的国王。
options.en: They wanted a handsome, powerful and active king.

analysis: 文中提到：“We want a handsome King - a powerful king, an active king.”因此选B。
